alert.note: Alert for Pierce (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 06 at 1:42PM PST until January 07 at 11:18AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... South Prairie Creek at South Prairie affecting Pierce County. .Heavy rain will continue today across the region, with local low elevation snow melt, leading to flooding. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Prairie Creek at South Prairie. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 4000.0 cfs, South Prairie Creek will flood low lying areas and roads from the Town of South Prairie downstream to the Carbon River near Orting. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM PST Thursday the flow was 3840.0 cfs. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 4495.0 cfs late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood flow is 4000.0 cfs. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 4650.0 cfs on 11/25/1999. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 945 PM PST.
